author: rhuijben
msg: * subversion/libsvn_subr/utf.c
(svn_utf_cstring_to_utf8, svn_utf_cstring_from_utf8): Revert r36334, apr
has two different native formats on Windows. One for files and one for
user io. This should be fixed on another level.

author: stsp
msg: * STATUS: My concerns regarding branches/1.6.x-no-svn_uri have been
addressed in since r36332, so vote +1.

author: rhuijben
msg: [reverted in r36336: apr has two encodings on Windows]
* subversion/libsvn_subr/utf.c
(svn_utf_cstring_to_utf8, svn_utf_cstring_from_utf8):
On platforms where the apr internal character set is always UTF-8,
just copy the data instead of attempting to convert it. On converting
to utf-8 keep the validation step for compatibility reasons.
(This optimization applies to Windows and Mac OS).
On Windows this avoids initializing COM in our process for only
doing simple things like parsing the passed pathnames.

author: lgo
msg: Follow-up r36331.
* subversion/libsvn_ra_serf/auth.c
(svn_ra_serf__handle_auth): Fixed merge conflict resolution.

author: rhuijben
msg: * subversion/libsvn_subr/private_uri.h
(global): Update comment and update #define in standard internal format.
